intro: Luma hookeri, commonly known as the golden moss-wood, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Luma hookeri is considered a rare and endangered species.
